paper_title.ja: X-ray line polarization spectroscopy to study hot electron transport in ultra-short laser produced plasma（共著）
paper_title.en: X-ray line polarization spectroscopy to study hot electron transport in ultra-short laser produced plasma

description.en: Observation is reported of the polarization of the helium-like Cl-He alpha line (1s(2) S-1(0)- 1s2p P-1(1)), at 2.79 keV emitted from a triple-layer target irradiated with a 130 fs laser pulse. The polarization degree is determined as a function of overcoat thickness of the target. It is found that the emission from a layer closer to the target surface is polarized parallel to the surface direction whereas emission from a deeper region in perpendicular to the surface. The experimental result is analyzed using a two-dimensional (2D) Maxwellian distribution function for hot electrons. Beam-like distribution was found in the depth of plasma. (C) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

publication_name.ja: J. Quantitative Spectroscopy and Radiative Transfer
publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF QUANTITATIVE SPECTROSCOPY & RADIATIVE TRANSFER

paper_title.en: X-ray line polarization spectroscopy to study hot electron transport in ultra-short laser produced plasma

description.en: Observation is reported of the polarization of the helium-like Cl-He alpha line (1s(2) S-1(0)- 1s2p P-1(1)), at 2.79 keV emitted from a triple-layer target irradiated with a 130 fs laser pulse. The polarization degree is determined as a function of overcoat thickness of the target. It is found that the emission from a layer closer to the target surface is polarized parallel to the surface direction whereas emission from a deeper region in perpendicular to the surface. The experimental result is analyzed using a two-dimensional (2D) Maxwellian distribution function for hot electrons. Beam-like distribution was found in the depth of plasma. (C) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF QUANTITATIVE SPECTROSCOPY & RADIATIVE TRANSFER

paper_title.ja: Study of fast electron transport in hot dense matter using x-ray spectroscopy（共著）
paper_title.en: Study of fast electron transport in hot dense matter using x-ray spectroscopy

description.en: Experimental study on energy transport in ultra-high intensity laser plasma was made. X-ray emission from a triple-layer target irradiated at 10(19) W cm(-2) was observed with x-ray spectrographs, monochromatic imagers and an x-ray polarimeter to provide a temperature profile in the depth of the target, lateral extension of the heated region and the velocity distribution function of hot electrons. For PW plasma, a very shallow region (similar to 0.5 mu m from the target surface) was heated up to 650 eV but the temperature of deeper region (up to 5 mu m) was around 100 eV. These depths are much shorter than those expected from the classical penetration of the hot electrons. The localized energy deposition is also found for the plasma generated at 10(17) W cm(-2), and the degree of polarization of the helium-like Cl-He mu line (1s(2 1)S(0)-ls2p P-1(1)) from the surface region is polarized parallel to the surface direction whereas that from a deeper region is in perpendicular to it. The experimental result is analysed using a two-dimensional Maxwellian distribution function for hot electrons. Beam-like distribution was found in the depth of plasma.

paper_title.en: Study of fast electron transport in hot dense matter using x-ray spectroscopy

description.en: Experimental study on energy transport in ultra-high intensity laser plasma was made. The experimental result is analysed using a two-dimensional Maxwellian distribution function for hot electrons. Beam-like distribution was found in the depth of plasma.

paper_title.ja: Polarization of radiation emitted from He-like ions following electron impact（共著）
paper_title.en: Polarization of radiation emitted from He-like ions following electron impact

description.en: We have performed semi-relativistic R-matrix calculations with the lowest 17 target levels and non-relativistic R-matrix calculations with the lowest 11 target terms for electron-impact excitation of the 1s2p P-1(t) state of He-like ions (Be2+, C4+, O6+, Cl15+, Fe24+, Kr34+ and Xe52+) to obtain polarization fraction at low incident electron energies. Results are compared with those available in previous calculations and experiment. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.ja: Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research B
publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.ja: Collision strengths and rate coefficients for excitation of He-like ions by electron impact（共著）
paper_title.en: Collision strengths and rate coefficients for excitation of He-like ions by electron impact

description.en: We present collision strengths and rate coefficients for electron-impact excitation of He-like ions (S14+, Ar16+, Ca18+) using the Dirac Atomic R-matrix Code, which has been developed by Norrington and Grant [J. Phys. B: At. Mol. Opt. Phys. 20 (1987) 4869]. The lowest 45 target levels are included in the calculation to obtain the rate coefficients for the Is 2 S-1(0)-1snl L-1,3(J) (n = 2,3,4; l = 0, 1, 2,3). Results are compared with those available in previous calculations. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.ja: Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research B
publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.ja: Energy levels and radiative rates for transitions in Ar XIII, Ar XIV and Ar XV（共著）
paper_title.en: Energy levels and radiative rates for transitions in Ar XIII, Ar XIV and Ar XV

description.en: Energies for 524 levels of Ar XIII, 460 levels of Ar XIV and 156 levels of Ar XV have been calculated using the GRASP code of Dyall et al. (1989). Additionally, radiative rates, oscillator strengths, and line strengths are calculated for all electric dipole (E1), magnetic dipole (M1), electric quadrupole (E2), and magnetic quadrupole (M2) transitions among these levels. Comparisons are made with the limited results available in the literature, and the accuracy of the data is assessed. Our energy levels are estimated to be accurate to better than 1%, whereas results for other parameters are probably accurate to better than 20%. Additionally, the level lifetimes derived from our radiative rates are in excellent agreement with measured values.

paper_title.en: Energy levels and radiative rates for transitions in Ar XIII, Ar XIV and Ar XV

description.en: Energies for 524 levels of Ar XIII, 460 levels of Ar XIV and 156 levels of Ar XV have been calculated using the GRASP code of Dyall et al. (1989). Additionally, radiative rates, oscillator strengths, and line strengths are calculated for all electric dipole (E1), magnetic dipole (M1), electric quadrupole (E2), and magnetic quadrupole (M2) transitions among these levels. Comparisons are made with the limited results available in the literature, and the accuracy of the data is assessed. Our energy levels are estimated to be accurate to better than 1%, whereas results for other parameters are probably accurate to better than 20%. Additionally, the level lifetimes derived from our radiative rates are in excellent agreement with measured values.

paper_title.ja: Electron-impact excitation of Si2+: differential cross sections and Stokes parameters(共著)
paper_title.en: Electron-impact excitation of Si2+: differential cross sections and Stokes parameters

description.en: We have performed the R-matrix calculations with 28 target states for electron-impact excitation of the 3s3p P-1(o) state of Si2+ from the ground 3S(2) S-1(e) state. We have calculated differential cross sections of this excitation process as well as Stokes parameters of the photons emitted on the decay of the excited state to the ground state. Results are presented for incident electron energies in the resonance region (10.5, 10.7, 10.9 and 11.1 eV) and non-resonance region (12.0, 12.2, 12.4 and 13.2 eV). We have also calculated total cross sections for the excitation process and compared these with the recent experimental measurements and other available theoretical calculations. The present results for the Stokes parameter P-3 show interesting features, which we discuss.

publication_name.ja: Journal of Physics B: Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics
publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF PHYSICS B-ATOMIC MOLECULAR AND OPTICAL PHYSICS

paper_title.en: Electron-impact excitation of Si2+: differential cross sections and Stokes parameters

description.en: We have performed the R-matrix calculations with 28 target states for electron-impact excitation of the 3s3p P-1(o) state of Si2+ from the ground 3S(2) S-1(e) state. We have calculated differential cross sections of this excitation process as well as Stokes parameters of the photons emitted on the decay of the excited state to the ground state. Results are presented for incident electron energies in the resonance region (10.5, 10.7, 10.9 and 11.1 eV) and non-resonance region (12.0, 12.2, 12.4 and 13.2 eV). We have also calculated total cross sections for the excitation process and compared these with the recent experimental measurements and other available theoretical calculations. The present results for the Stokes parameter P-3 show interesting features, which we discuss.

paper_title.ja: Elastic Scattering of Electrons from Na-like Ions(共著)
paper_title.en: Elastic scattering of electrons from Na-like ions

description.en: Differential cross sections for elastic scattering of electrons from Al2+ and Ar7+ are calculated with the R-matrix method. Using six different sets of coupled states, the convergence is tested against the number of coupled states in the calculation. The converged cross section is analysed in terms of the contributions of the long-range Coulomb force, the short-range electrostatic interaction and the interference of those two. A comparison with the recent measurement at 100 eV for Ar7+ shows disagreement in the vicinity of a scattering angle of 50degrees.

publication_name.ja: Journal of Physics Society of Japan
publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
